etymologies: late 16th century (in predator (sense 2)): from Latin praedator ‘plunderer’, from praedat- ‘seized as plunder’, from the verb praedari (see predation)

definitions: an animal that naturally preys on others

examples.text: wolves are major predators of rodents
females defend the nest by actively chasing off predators

shortDefinitions: animal that naturally preys on others

definitions: a person or group that ruthlessly exploits others

examples.text: her wealth made her vulnerable to predators

definitions: a company that tries to take over another

examples.text: a defensive move to prevent the business falling into the hands of an overseas predator

shortDefinitions: company that tries to take over another
